com.exacttarget.etpushsdk

Class ETLocationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.ETLocationManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.OnConnectionFailedListener

    public class ETLocationManager
extends Object
implements com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.OnConnectionFailedListener
    ETLocationManager is responsible for finding an accurate location and retrieving a list of Geofence regions and their associated messages from your MobilePush account in the SFMC.



    These regions are monitored for entry and exit and will trigger the notification messages you setup in your MobilePush SFMC account when the Geofence boundaries are crossed.

    You can only use the methods in this class if you enabled Location when you called ETPush.configureSdk(ETPushConfig, ETPushConfigureSdkListener) and set locationEnabled to true. Remember that you should only enable Locations if you have purchased this feature in your SFMC account and wish to add the overhead associated with your app to monitor the regions that are downloaded by the SDK.

    • Field Summary

      • startWatchingLocation

        public void startWatchingLocation()
        Enables location monitoring in the SDK.

        This method should be called when explicit permission for Location monitoring has been given by your customer.

        See Also:
        isWatchingLocation(), stopWatchingLocation()

      • startWatchingProximity

        public boolean startWatchingProximity()
        Enables Beacon ranging in the SDK. This is currently in BETA testing only and should not be used without explicit directions from your SFMC account manager. Note that you must enable location monitoring both in configureSdk(Context) and with startWatchingLocation() in order to range for Beacons.

        This method should be called when explicit permission for ranging for Beacons has been given by your customer.
        Returns:
        boolean - true if we successfully started monitoring Beacons, false if Bluetooth LE is available, but not currently turned on.
        See Also:
        isWatchingProximity(), stopWatchingProximity()

      • stopWatchingLocation

        public void stopWatchingLocation()
        Disables location monitoring in the SDK.

        This method should be called when explicit permission for location monitoring has been revoked by your customer.

        See Also:
        isWatchingLocation(), startWatchingLocation()

      • stopWatchingProximity

        public void stopWatchingProximity()
        Disables Beacon ranging in the SDK.

        This method should be called when explicit permission for Beacon ranging has been revoked by your customer.

        See Also:
        isWatchingProximity(), startWatchingProximity()

      • isWatchingLocation

        public boolean isWatchingLocation()
        Checks SDK instance of app SharedPreferences for the state of location monitoring.

        If you enable location monitoring in ETPush.configureSdk(ETPushConfig, ETPushConfigureSdkListener), then location monitoring will be enabled by default.

        Best practice is to allow your customers to disable or enable location monitoring through a preferences or settings activity. Use startWatchingLocation() or stopWatchingLocation() to respond to your customer preferences.

        Returns:
        boolean The state of location monitoring, either enabled (true) or disabled (false)
        See Also:
        startWatchingLocation(), stopWatchingLocation()

      • isWatchingProximity

        public boolean isWatchingProximity()
        Checks SDK instance of app SharedPreferences for the state of Beacon ranging.

        If you enable Beacon ranging in ETPush.configureSdk(ETPushConfig, ETPushConfigureSdkListener), then Beacon ranging will be enabled by default.

        Best practice is to allow your customers to disable or enable Beacon ranging through a preferences or settings activity. Use startWatchingProximity() or stopWatchingProximity() to respond to your customer preferences.

        Returns:
        boolean The state of Beacon ranging, either enabled (true) or disabled (false)
        See Also:
        startWatchingProximity(), stopWatchingProximity()

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent(LastKnownLocationEvent event)
        Internal use only. Do not call directly.

        Internal EventBus handler for letting us know that we received a new location for this device

      • onEvent

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent(GeofenceResponseEvent event)
        Internal use only. Do not call directly.

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent(BeaconResponseEvent event)
        Internal use only. Do not call directly.
